column1: Valley fever is an infection that occurs when the spores of the fungus Coccidioides immitis enter your body through the lungs.
Valley fever is a fungal infection most commonly seen in the desert regions of the southwestern United States, and in Central and South America.
You get it by breathing in the fungus from soil.
The infection starts in the lungs.
Valley fever may also be called coccidioidomycosis.
Traveling to an area where the fungus is commonly seen raises your risk for this infection.

You are also more likely to develop a serious infection if you have a weakened immune system due to: - Anti-tumor necrosis factor (TNF) therapy - Cancer - Chemotherapy - Glucocorticoid medications (prednisone) - Heart-lung conditions - HIV - Organ transplant - Pregnancy (especially the first trimester) People of Native American, African, or Philippine descent may also get more severe cases.
